definition: to hold back from saying precisely what is on one's mind
secret/hidden/concealed/(prefix) crypto-
to lean upon
to avoid mentioning/taboo word/name of deceased emperor or superior
cross symbol (×), used to replace a character one does not wish to display

sentences.english: Bing Xin never covered up her relation with religion.
sentences.chinese: 冰心從不隱諱自己同宗教的關係。

sentences.english: Mr Alexander is not the slightest bit coy about his ambitions.
sentences.chinese: 亞歷山大先生對自己的抱負毫不隱諱。

sentences.english: He made no bones about his extreme left-wing views.
sentences.chinese: 他毫不隱諱自己極左的觀點。

sentences.english: One should not gloss over one's shortcomings.

definition: lit. a thief crying "Stop the thief!" (idiom)/fig. to accuse sb of a theft and try to sneak away oneself/to cover up one's misdeeds by shifting the blame onto others
to whisper to one another's ear
keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
hiding place/hideout
equivocal/ambiguous
(not) a single person/(no) one
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
protective coloration/camouflage
trivial matter/a piece of cake
female gossip/busybody
extreme benevolence, utmost duty (idiom); meticulous virtue and attention to duty
a gleam of hope
to bite the hand that feeds one (idiom)
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
